sen.j: 長髄彦（ながすねひこ）は、日本神話に登場する人物。
sen.e: Nagasunehiko is a character that appears in Japanese mythology.

sen.e: He is portrayed in the scene of Jinmu Tosei (Emperor Jinmu's expedition to the east) as the head of a local ruling family in the Yamato Province area who opposed Jinmu's expedition to the east.

sen.j: 長髄彦は神武天皇に「昔、天つ神の子が天の磐船に乗って降臨した。名を櫛玉饒速日命という。私の妹の三炊屋媛を娶わせて、可美真手という子も生まれた。ゆえに私は饒速日命を君として仕えている。天つ神の子がどうして二人いようか。どうして天つ神の子であると称して人の土地を奪おうとしているのか」とその疑いを述べた。
sen.e: Nagasunehiko addressed his question to Emperor Jinmu, "Long ago, a child of Amatsu kami (god of heaven) descended, riding on Ame no iwafune (rock boat of heaven). His name was Kushitama Nigihayahi no Mikoto. He married my younger sister, Mikashigiyahime, and a child named Umashimade was born. Therefore, I serve Nigihayahi no Mikoto as my lord. How could there be 2 children of God. How can you try to steal other people's land when you call yourself Amatsu kami's son?"

sen.j: 天皇は天つ神の子である証拠として、天の羽羽矢と歩靱を見せ、長髄彦は恐れ畏まったが、改心することはなかった。
sen.e: The Emperor showed Ame no haha ya (the heavenly feathered arrows) and Kachiyuki (Japanese quiver) as his proof of being Amatsu kami's son, and even though Nagasunehiko was awed, he did not reform himself.

sen.j: そのため、間を取り持つことが無理だと知った饒速日命（ニギハヤヒノミコト）に殺された。
sen.e: Therefore, he was killed by Nigihayahi no Mikoto, who realized that it was impossible to mediate between the Emperor and Nagasunehiko.

sen.j: 饒速日命の手によって殺された、或いは失脚後に故地に留まり死去したともされているが、実際は同胞である和邇氏（海神族）の協力を経て北上し、時の畿内の有力豪族安日彦（アビヒコ）とともに青森県は弘前に落ち着いたという説がある。
sen.e: It is said that he was killed by the hands of Nigihayahi no Mikoto, and alternatively, it is also said that he died after remaining in the area where he eventually died after his failure, but there are theories that imply that in actuality, he advanced north with the support of the Wani clan (Watatsumi family), who was his sibling clan, and he settled in Hirosaki, Aomori Prefecture, with Abihiko, who was a powerful ruling clan in Kinai region then, and there is a lore regarding the potential site of his death that hints the possibility of his involvement in the eastern expedition because he performed a Shinto ritual, due to the political instability prior to the eastern expedition, in which an arrow was aimed toward the sun, and there is also a theory that says that he committed suicide because of the Yaoi clan who claimed to be the descendant.

sen.j: また、東征前に政情不安から太陽に対して弓を引く神事を行ったという東征にも関与していた可能性をも匂わせる故地の候補地の伝承、自らを後裔と主張する矢追氏による自死したという説もある。
